meanings.definition: To use capital letters in writing.
meanings.sent1: Remember to CAPITALISE the first letter of each sentence.
meanings.sent2: In formal writing, it is important to capitalise proper nouns.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to capitalise the title of their essays.
meanings.sent4: She decided to capitalise every word in the heading to make it stand out.
meanings.sent5: The sign was designed to capitalise attention and draw in customers.

meanings.definition: To provide funding for a business or project.
meanings.sent1: The investors agreed to capitalise the new startup.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to capitalise the construction of the new bridge.
meanings.sent3: The company's decision to capitalise the expansion project paid off.
meanings.sent4: By capitalising the business venture, they ensured its success.
meanings.sent5: The generous donation was meant to capitalise the growth of the small business.

meanings.definition: To take advantage of a situation for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: He tried to capitalise on his opponent's mistake during the game.
meanings.sent2: Some people tend to capitalise on others' misfortunes for their benefit.
meanings.sent3: The salesman saw an opportunity to capitalise on the high demand for the product.
meanings.sent4: She always knows how to capitalise on a good deal when she sees one.
meanings.sent5: The politician sought to capitalise on the public's dissatisfaction with the current policies.
